ygData.subject: RE: Trueshot Bow
ygData.msgSnippet: I have not had a problem selling Darkwood Bows, and I sell them for 600pp (Sold about 7 or 8 now).  Granted it s a limited market, but I can sell them.  Oaks I
ygData.messageBody:
I have not had a problem selling Darkwood Bows, and I sell them for 600pp
(Sold about 7 or 8 now). Granted it's a limited market, but I can sell
them. Oaks I use mostly for trading, I will not trade a Darkwood for
anything. And I like the idea of no pricing on the Trueshot Bow, I will try
that.


-----Original Message-----
From: Nick Emmerich [mailto:seorin@...]
Sent: Monday, August 02, 1999 4:09 PM
To: EQ_Fletchers@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ_Fletchers] Trueshot Bow


From: Nick Emmerich <seorin@...>

I find the best tactic is to not mention your price. Just auction that
you're
selling a trueshot. If someone is interested, ask. Send them a tell, NEVER
answer publicly. If they have a problem, they simply /tell you to jump off a
cliff and go about their business. The best part is, they're not ruining
your
sales by spreading their ideas of proper pricing to the zone.Unfortunately,
bows
don't sell well period. I've never sold one trueshot at 200pp. I sold ONE
Shaped
Darkwood 1-Cam Bow for 300pp plus a cracked darkwood shield, and I had to
give
away 20 class 6 steel bladed arrows to help him make up his mind. Well, if I
sell that shield for 300pp (giving me the 600pp for the bow I normally
charge)
I'm still making 240pp... (200 skill, haven't failed a bow yet). Perhaps the
real market is selling Shaped Darkwood 1-Cams (second best for damage to
delay.
Best is trueshot, and that's 50 less range) to level 30+ warriors :) Sold
mine
to a guy who looked REALLY decked out in armor.

-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM
